item.title: Bootstrapped.fm, episode 34, "Don't Shake the SaaS Tree."
item.dc:creator: ian
item.description:
Yeah, DDoS is yet another reason SaaS is really scary

I don’t think there’s any going back, everyone will just pay services to protect them eventually. No going back to everyone downloading software, at least not with SaaS backends (like for apps) but still. The low early revenue and the high stress and uptime requirements always make me wonder why people talk so highly with no negatives on SaaS

item.dc:creator: Oliver
item.description:
@ian @andrey I don’t know if you guys recorded the episode yet, but I’m wondering if this sort of thing comes into play for you:

The Verge – 4 Mar 14

Give me $300 or the website gets it!

This past Thursday at 10:26AM, Meetup CEO Heiferman got a strange email. "A competitor asked me to perform a DDoS attack on your website. I can stop the attack for $300 USD. Let me know if you are...

It seems these scenarios are on the rise. From personal experience I know the Linode data center my VPS is on is attacked fairly routinely, and my uptime suffers as a result. Does pure Software as a Service (as in completely web-based apps) have a future in a world like this?

item.description:
Guys! We can tell your voices apart. We just don’t know who each voice belongs to. I’m pretty sure I’ve listened to complete episodes of your podcast without you ever saying who is who.

Maybe try saying each other’s name periodically during the podcast. “So Ian, tell me…” or “Andrey, you are completely right…” or something regularly through the podcast for the sake of us listeners?
